msContents.summary: A small part from the Nāradīyapurāṇa. It is belived that this text contains around 2000 verses from the Nāradīyapurāṇa but some variations regarding the actual number of verses is found. One text of the Haribhaktisudhodaya is published with translation into Bengali and is in bengali script.

msItem.title: Haribhaktisudhodaya of Nāradīyapurāṇa

filiation.p: Notices of Sanskrit Manuscripts Vol. XIII: p 231, Ms 265 Sharada Oriental Series no 1: XIII Delhi. ignca.nic.in//Asi_data//78093.pdf Aufrecht Catalogus vol. 1 p. 758

msItem.incipit: [1v 1] ekaṃ yajjanayatyanekatanubhṛt śasyānyajalaṃ mitho bhinnākāraguṇāni kaiścidapi vā noptaṃ na siktaṃ jalaiḥ
msItem.explicit: [91r 6] ….. ya imam śṛṇuyāt bhaktyā śriharibhaktisuyodayaṃ kathayet sarvapāpā [91v 1] t mukto mokṣaṃ sa gacchati .
msItem.finalRubric: [91v 1] iti nāradiye purāṇe haribhaktisuyodaye viṃśodhyāyaḥ ௳ śrikṛṣṇāya paramātmane [91v 2] namaḥ hariḥ oṃ śubhamastu varṇavyañjanapa?ktināṃ yannyunādhikyamatra tadidaṃ kṣamyatāṃ sa ??? mastebhyo namonamaḥ [91v 3] śrīlakṣmīnarasiṃhaparabhrahmaṇe namaḥ śrivainateyāya namaḥ௳ oṃ ௳

support.p: Thin palm leaves are used as guard folio. First guard folio is preserved with think red colored twine.

extent.measure: 2 guard folio, 3 blank folio, 91 written folio

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil letter numerals in the left margin.
supportDesc.condition: Intial folio are broken. Corners are torned. many folio are worm eaten.

handNote.desc: Written clean, sometimes strokes are mixed with the other letters.

additions.desc: hariḥ oṃ śubhamastu is wriiten in the left margin followed by folio number.
haribhakti is wriiten in the left margin.

Sudhodaya Nāradīya is written in Devanagari script on the front guard cover with the numer III in the left side of the folio and number 4 written with the blue pencil at the centre of the folio and same numer with the pink pencil in the left side of the folio.
Sticker of numer 43 is glued on the fron guard folio.
